description: These scenarios have different victory conditions, special rules, or both. Warband-Building Scenarios: In these scenarios, one player or all players alter their warbands in some way.
name: Basic Scenarios

description: First, the players decide how many points each warband should have (the default is 100 points), then all players design their war- bands. Next, the players choose a scenario and set up the battle. Instead of choosing a scenario, you can roll ran- domly to determine which one you play. Since different scenarios favor different warbands, rolling randomly for sce- narios can be more fair than choosing them. 102 :5 RETPAHC HSIMRIKS SELUR nippaT .S yb .sullI 620_96582_MinisHndbk.qxd 8/19/03 11:05 AM Page 102 Wraith

Rarely, a formed unit has melee contact with an enemy unit only on a corner. In this case, the contact is considered to be along whichever edge is closer to the enemy unit. The first 1 inch of that line can cross ter- rain that grants partial cover without affecting the attack. For example, a ranged unit can stand just inside the edge of a woods and shoot out at enemies without penalty while benefiting from cover itself.
name: Shooting Out of Partial Cover

description: Woods are the only stan- dard terrain type that provides partial cover. Low Cover Low cover works like partial cover, except that the defender has to be near the terrain for it to provide any protection.
name: Partial Cover Terrain Types

description: Low cover applies only to units within 6 inches of the terrain.
name: Cover Range

description: An attacking unit can ignore terrain that provides low cover if it is closer to that terrain than the defending unit is. That is, any low cover that’s closer to the attacking unit than the defending unit doesn’t provide cover for the defender.
name: Ignoring Nearby Cover

description: A unit with this special ability can move, make a mass strike, then move again, as long as the distance it moves during its turn doesn’t exceed its speed. If it moves away from a unit that engages it, it provokes an attack of opportunity nor- mally and must end at least 1 inch away from that unit, but it does not need to make a morale save.

description: Any unit on the stony ground surrounding the skull scores a critical hit when its melee attack roll is a natural 19 or 20.
